name: ABC
text:
COMING UP: He's the man President Trump doesn't want you to hear.

Now, John Bolton, Trump’s former trusted national security adviser, finally speaks out. What will he say?

Don’t miss this news making event special—starts at 9/8c on @ABC. https://t.co/TrDMhiYdKp https://t.co/kJsmnsD4KN

name: ABC
text: Third-party standing could impact abortion cases down the road. https://t.co/X5FcIKZNQ9

name: ABC
text: RT @ABCWorldNews: BOLTON EXCLUSIVE: @MarthaRaddatz has more from her exclusive interview with John Bolton, pressing him on his explosive allegations against President Trump in his new book – and why he’s going public now. The full interview airs tonight at 9|8c on @ABC. https://t.co/t5DR5Tm6qG https://t.co/OsNKAUg7SS

name: ABC
text: A dozen states have seen record highs of new COVID-19 cases since Friday, an @ABC News analysis has found. https://t.co/i3aQXHLbp0

name: ABC
text:
John Bolton, Pres. Trump's longest-serving national security adviser, goes one-on-one with @MarthaRaddatz.

The special event starts now on @ABC. https://t.co/ugOLXbXInK https://t.co/2mGwtBqPQN

name: ABC
text: John Bolton on Pres. Trump: "When it comes to reelection, his attention span was infinite…It's just too bad there wasn't more of that when it came to national security.” https://t.co/nI9KzsYyZL https://t.co/B8bgrfn9dP

name: ABC
text: NEW: John Bolton on letters to Pres. Trump he believed to be from North Korean leader Kim Jong Un: "I think Kim Jong Un gets a huge laugh out of this...Yet, the president has looked at them as evidence of this deep friendship." https://t.co/MoKEz7WP1E https://t.co/n8fVsqc7hq

name: ABC
text:
.@MarthaRaddatz: “How would you describe Trump's relationship with Vladimir Putin?”

John Bolton: “I think Putin thinks he can play him like a fiddle.” https://t.co/lhlnTwWPfm https://t.co/rMU80KNJrR

name: ABC
text:
EXCLUSIVE: John Bolton says Pres. Trump has left the U.S. in a "weaker position around the world."
 
"Whether it's after four years or eight years, whoever succeeds the Trump administration is going to have an enormous amount of repair work to do." https://t.co/Q2XgGRP4gg https://t.co/ScE0pwD5Ae

name: ABC
text:
"Minds were made up on Capitol Hill."
 
John Bolton defends his decision not to testify during the impeachment trial, telling @martharaddatz, "It would not have made a difference." https://t.co/jiL4cpAnp7 https://t.co/P3z87I43AM

name: ABC
text: John Bolton on impeachment process: "I think the House Democrats built a cliff, they threw themselves off of it. And halfway down, they looked up and saw me, and said, 'Hey, why don't you come along?'" https://t.co/8MKqU8R35l https://t.co/JfSA4a5695

name: ABC
text: EXCLUSIVE: John Bolton tells @MarthaRaddatz that the claim Pres. Trump was generally concerned about corruption in Ukraine was "utter nonsense." https://t.co/Aaye3cMCng https://t.co/uAoEcACI2D

name: ABC
text:
John Bolton: "I tried to write a book that took the 17 months I spent as national security advisor and reveal a picture of the president that people can draw their own conclusions from."

"My conclusion is clear. I don't think he should be president." https://t.co/WPtQTFnQ1x https://t.co/jgvvc6AM5L

name: ABC
text:
From Russia to North Korea to Ukraine, John Bolton was in the room for key decisions of the Trump White House.

Read the broadcast transcript of his exclusive interview with @MarthaRaddatz. https://t.co/CLTwHymY5G

name: ABC
text:
.@MarthaRaddatz asked John Bolton: "Do you think U.S. national security is stronger or weaker because of Pres. Trump?"

Bolton: "I think we're in a weaker position around the world. I think we have given up leadership in a wide variety of areas." https://t.co/9CRQgds5cV https://t.co/XdKwkirmq6

name: ABC
text: EXCLUSIVE: John Bolton, Pres. Trump's longest-serving national security adviser, condemns Trump's presidency as dangerously damaging to the U.S.—and warns the 2020 election is the last "guardrail" to protect the country from him. https://t.co/DjPINItXPG

name: ABC
text: A statue of Theodore Roosevelt outside the American Museum of Natural History in New York City that has been criticized for symbolizing colonialism and racism will be removed, officials say. https://t.co/O3FwxfubT3

name: ABC
text: Lawyer for former Atlanta police officer who killed Rayshard Brooks says district attorney's investigation isn't credible. https://t.co/B0WtVJj5ci

name: ABC
text:
John Bolton told @MarthaRaddatz he's not planning to vote for Pres. Trump in November, but he's "certainly not gonna vote for Joe Biden either."

"I'm gonna figure out a conservative Republican to write in." https://t.co/GMDvqok4Ws https://t.co/QDrmJYnhDn

name: ABC
text: Politicians call for California attorney general to investigate fatal shooting of 18-year-old by sheriff's deputy. https://t.co/4j8efI0hW9

name: ABC
text: "I view the circumstance we’re in now really as the beginning of the fight for the soul of the Republican Party, post-Trump," John Bolton tells @MarthaRaddatz. "That battle begins immediately." https://t.co/VRDPGnNrYC https://t.co/bYjk9opTVl

name: ABC
text: John Bolton tells @ABC News that Pres. Trump mused he was looking forward more to a meeting with Russian Pres. Vladimir Putin than with U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May. https://t.co/BgZUg96XKI https://t.co/m80XsZPYxw

name: ABC
text: EXCLUSIVE: John Bolton, Pres. Trump's longest-serving national security adviser, condemns Trump's presidency as dangerously damaging to the U.S.—and warns the 2020 election is the last "guardrail" to protect the country from him. https://t.co/xYB842Z3P9

name: ABC
text: John Bolton tells @ABC News that Pres. Trump mused he was looking forward more to a meeting with Russian Pres. Vladimir Putin than with U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May. https://t.co/487NK4fKSx https://t.co/VJN74MaRN3

name: ABC
text:
In his new book, John Bolton says he was astonished by what he saw during his time as national security adviser.

Bolton tells @MarthaRaddatz he thinks Pres. Trump "was so focused" on reelection "that longer term considerations fell by the wayside." https://t.co/xz2bSs8pPz https://t.co/KEJPvfiijJ

name: ABC
text: EXCLUSIVE: John Bolton tells @MarthaRaddatz that foreign leaders have "mastered the art" of manipulating Pres. Trump—and that "the dictators seem to be better at it." https://t.co/8Kl7uB30K0 https://t.co/qz4JIqkztV

name: ABC
text: NASCAR said Sunday that a noose was found in the garage stall of a Black driver who had called for removing the Confederate flag from league events. https://t.co/Djtd2j8t1E

name: ABC
text: John Bolton says Pres. Trump's actions with Ukraine "could well amount" to high crimes and misdemeanors, and says "a range of other activities" should be investigated, but defends his decision not to come forward during impeachment trial. https://t.co/jiL4cpiM0x https://t.co/a6Z6LjGeYb

name: ABC
text:
Rubber bullets, pepper spray, batons, flash-bangs.

In law enforcement, they’re referred to as “nonlethal” tools for dealing with unruly demonstrations. But police critics say that the weaponry too often escalates tensions and hurts innocent people. https://t.co/pJ09YD3PYK

name: ABC
ABC
text: A Canadian motorist pulled his truck over and waded into waist-high water to help a deer that was struggling in Manitoba's Assiniboine River. https://t.co/LgVovJoYh1 https://t.co/dwfSz6fWRm

name: ABC
text:
.@MarthaRaddatz : “How would you describe Trump's relationship with Vladimir Putin?”

John Bolton: “I think Putin thinks he can play him like a fiddle.” https://t.co/EXO3qWdOkk https://t.co/Kac8UbnWyF

name: ABC
text: Pres. Trump has escalated his rhetoric against the Chinese government. But John Bolton tells @MarthaRaddatz his harsh words mask a softness on China and a penchant for its president, Xi Jinping. https://t.co/aI7CUgVJwb

name: ABC
text:
John Bolton told @MarthaRaddatz he's not planning to vote for Pres. Trump in November, but he's "certainly not gonna vote for Joe Biden either."

"I'm gonna figure out a conservative Republican to write in." https://t.co/Ctlw3Qu4Ks https://t.co/jenGkxmUhs

name: ABC
text: Hummingbirds can see colors humans can only imagine, an ability that now sheds light on an extra dimension of animal vision, a new study finds. Via @InsideScience. https://t.co/N8M6lzafnX

name: ABC
text: Fifty-three children died in hot cars last year. https://t.co/MH4higbSr3

name: ABC
text: Foul play is suspected in the death of a Fort Hood soldier, whose remains were found 10 months after he went missing, military officials say. https://t.co/KOCfrpFSza

name: ABC
text: An Indianapolis couple married for 67 years were finally reunited after five weeks apart – their longest ever separation – while wife Joyce battled COVID-19. https://t.co/DaoyxwiNtl https://t.co/7TouT85sFr

name: ABC
text: A college professor been placed on administrative leave following a racist incident where he refused to call a student by her given name and instructed her to “anglicize” her name. https://t.co/q3wp5n0ZuE

name: ABC
text: What happens to a college town when the students disappear? Ithaca, a small upstate New York city nearby gorges and vineyards, is finding out. https://t.co/QeFuxcWV17

name: ABC
text:
ERUPTION: Indonesia's Mount Merapi volcano spews ash and hot gas in a towering column as high as 3.7 miles into the sky.⁣
⁣
The 9,737-foot mountain is the most active of 500 Indonesian volcanoes. https://t.co/Ilpsh6gWQ6 https://t.co/3udp7RbCc0

name: ABC
text: One person wounded in what was the second shooting in Seattle's protest zone in less than 48 hours, police say. https://t.co/WtRQlfBJYI

name: ABC
text: Eight Minnesota correctional officers of color have filed a discrimination complaint alleging they were barred from guarding Derek Chauvin, the former police officer charged with murdering George Floyd. https://t.co/ER27y7XtbU

name: ABC
text:
A 75-foot-tall monument to fallen Confederate soldiers has been removed from North Carolina’s State Capitol grounds in Raleigh.

Gov. Roy Cooper says he “ordered the Confederate monuments on the Capitol grounds be moved to protect public safety.” https://t.co/VK4i1br61S https://t.co/L929xOC9oM

name: ABC
text: A solid majority of Americans disapprove of President Trump's handling of the coronavirus, a new @ABC News/Ipsos poll finds. https://t.co/Oc8isq68Pu

name: ABC
text: Sen. Chuck Schumer is urging an investigation into the ouster of SDNY attorney Geoffrey Berman: "The late Friday night dismissal reeked of potential corruption of the legal process." https://t.co/yFlWCrQk8w https://t.co/ByuPHFSuLQ

name: ABC
text: Two people killed and seven others wounded in shooting in North Carolina's largest city, police say, while five others were hit by vehicles afterward. https://t.co/ox7zErbqKp

name: ABC
text: Even though many potential COVID-19 vaccines require different pharmaceutical ingredients and processes, drugmakers the world over have found themselves racing to acquire a key ingredient without which they can't distribute their live-saving drugs: glass. https://t.co/vBtAXTMP70

name: ABC
text: NEW: U.S. Ambassador to the U.K. Woody Johnson confirms an American national was among the three victims of a terrorist stabbing in the U.K. on Saturday night. https://t.co/YmKcYWobHx
